Title: the perspiration implementation

Leonard: Hey, ready for lunch?
That’ll teach her to care about your health.
It wouldn’t be the worst thing if we were more active.
Look at all these activities the university has. Rock climbing club, archery, flag football.
What are you saying? We’re not coordinated enough to play sports?
I got a triple-word score with a double letter Q. If that’s not a time to bust out the scrabble dance, what’s the point of having one? Hey, Barry Kripke started a fencing club.
It’s indoors, so no sunscreen.
No gym shorts that can be yanked down.
Preach.
What about a game of tag on a French schoolyard?
I always wanted to be a swashbuckler when I was a kid.
That’s not why we’re here.
This is easy. I didn’t need to wear a cup.
What?
When was your honour insulted?
Again, that doctor didn’t insult your honour. Just checked your prostate.
Well, good. It’s nice to see your mind off Amy.
Oh. I hate to say it, but it sounds like he’s interested in her.
Oh, buddy, I get that you don’t like it, but it’s not really up to you.
Look, even if it’s not him, Amy’s probably going to date someone at some point.
Of course. She deserves to be happy.
Listen, I should warn you that maybe asking Amy out isn’t a good idea.
And now the crazy version of what I just said.
Wow. That, that was crazier than I thought.
I’m surprised you wanted to go to a sports bar, Sheldon.
If you’re cranky and retaining water, I have a theory.
Maybe you should consider women who aren’t in serious relationships with your closest friends?
Three.
You’re just sweaty from exercise.
I know it only takes one doctor’s finger.
We should let you guys talk.
Look at me go.
Howard: No, Bernadette got me a Fitbit so she can track how much I’m exercising.
Yeah, I can’t wait to see the look on her face when I die young.
The other day, when she tried to put that Fitbit on me and I ran away from her.
You make an excellent point. Ooh, I think I’m getting a runner’s high.
And maybe a little Princess Bride.
Yeah. I already ran 18 miles today.
When you’re in a public restroom, which foot do you flush the toilet with?
Oh, God, I am going to feel this tomorrow.
My name is Inigo Montoya. You killed my father. Prepare to die.
I thought you were Puss in Boots.
My name is Darth Vader. I am your father. Prepare to die.
Sheldon, instead of focusing on Amy dating other guys, maybe you should start thinking about dating another girl.
Sheldon: Is that the prototype drive system for the high-G rover?
According to a recent study, simply thinking about exercise, even while sitting still, can have physical benefits. For all you know, I could be exercising right now.
Nah, I’ll do it tomorrow.
Had me at flag, lost me at football.
Interesting. Sword fighting does hold a certain elegant appeal. And I would imagine it meets many of our personal criteria for a sport.
No throwing, no catching, no running.
Or worse, up.
And as an added bonus, the word touché comes from fencing. It would be our only opportunity to use it in a non-metaphorical sense.
Ah, touché.
Technically, swashbuckler is a combination of two terms. Swash referring to the sound of the sword. Swash. And then buckler meaning a small shield, which you don’t have.
We’re not afraid of physical activity.
Oh, dear.
Well, I’m not sure I have a dominant leg. They’re both pretty submissive.
Right. Always right.
Excuse me, Barry?
When can I stab one of my friends?
Uh, yes, I’m aware. But if I say I want to touch one of my friends, I’ll get called into Human Resources.
En garde, Leonard. Prepare yourself for a rigorous touching.
I’m looking forward to him teaching us glove-slapping.
You know, when my honour is insulted, and I need to challenge someone to a duel by slapping them across the face with my glove.
My last physical.
Ah, this is fun.
Not that it’s any of your business, but she broke up with me.
Good to know? What’s that supposed to mean?
Well, that’s unacceptable.
Yeah, but he’s dumb, and his face is dumb.
You really think so?
How dare you.
Barry, a word?
If you intend to pursue Amy, you leave me with no choice but to put a stop to it.
By challenging you to a duel.
That is why the duel will take place at high noon, three years from today. If you’re worth your salt as an instructor, I should be ready by then. Yeah, and be warned. I’m going to touch you all over.
Look at this blister. Like it or not, we’re athletes now. Besides, a bar is where I belong. I’m having female problems.
That’s ridiculous.
True, but Penny’s married, and so is Bernadette. And your girlfriend has red hair and white skin, which really rubs up against my clown phobia.
There’s that prostate doctor, but I’m still mad at her. Oh, there’s a woman. I’ll make her my girlfriend.
You’re forgetting something. Ladies love jocks.
Excuse me. I’m recovering from a recent breakup, and I’m told asking out another woman might make me feel better. And as Ash Ketchum said to Pikachu, I choose you.
It’s a Pokémon reference.
Well, we gave it a shot. How about you?
Ah, what might have been. And you, give my regards to Barnum and Bailey.
I smell funny. I taste salty.
And kind of delicious. I wonder how many licks it would take to get to the centre of me.
Hello.
You don’t have to leave.
I’m doing all right. I tried fencing today.
It was pretty easy. And I think my background in mathletics helped. Barry Kripke was there. I should let you know that he expressed interest in asking you out.
Okay. But don’t get too attached to him. in two years, 364 days, he’s a dead man.
Interesting. I asked two women out today, and they both said no.
I’ve been told it’s a good way to move on.
Thanks. And I taste good too.
Raj: When was the last actual exercise you got?
I feel cool. Like Puss in Boots.
Yeah, I’m here because I think it’s gonna be like Game of Thrones.
Ooh, ooh, I forgot about Princess Bride. That’s my answer.
Look at us. We’re like the Rockettes.
My name is Inigo Montoya. You killed my father. Prepare to die.
Oh, yeah, right. Sorry. My name is Puss in Boots. You killed my father. Prepare to die.
My name is Little Orphan Annie. You killed my father. Prepare to die.
Why? You never thought you’d end up in a relationship, and then you met Amy. Maybe there’s someone else out there for you.
Whoa, whoa. Walking up to a strange woman in a bar usually doesn’t work.
How many sips of that beer did he have?
Penny: Yeah, I think it’s great you guys want to get more exercise, but do you really think sports is the right choice for you?
Okay, Leonard, sweetheart, you twisted your ankle playing Scrabble.
All right, well, what have you tried so far?
Really? In a comic book store?
Hey, have you read the online reviews for this place?

All right, well, Heather H says, the owner stared at me the whole time and didn’t blink once. Kelly M says, the creepy guy who runs it asked me out, then called himself stupid before I could say no. Jessica K says, I told the weird owner that I liked his shirt. He took it off and gave it to me.
Well, you’re talking to us now. I mean, you don’t seem nervous.
Okay. Don’t be offended, but, what went wrong with you?
Well, he knew he was on the breast cam.
And sometimes we marry them anyway.
I told you things would change if you plucked your eyebrows.
Well, what are you gonna do?
I think she means not a weirdo.
All right, well, what happens if you imagine him naked?
Stuart: Well, I know more women are buying comics than ever, but for some reason, I, I can’t get ’em in here.
Uh, I’ve, I’ve been stocking more female-oriented titles. Uh, in the bathroom, I folded the end of the toilet paper into a triangle. And, uh, you are now sitting in the official breastfeeding area.
Oh, don’t worry. I, I’ve got a camera right up here, so I could watch from the counter and make sure guys aren’t being pervs. Anyway, so what do I got to do to, to get you in the door?
Well, you don’t know the backstory. Maybe she kept jumping up on the couch.
Hmm, okay. Well, alright, what if I put up a sign in the window that said women, come in. Don’t be afraid.
Eh, the Internet’s so negative. I try to avoid it.
All right, I’m not saying it’s true, but let’s, let’s consider for a moment that possibly I’m the problem.
Okay, fine. What, I mean, what can I do? I get so nervous around women.
Well, that’s ’cause I’m doing that trick where you imagine the audience is naked. By the way, thumbs up, ladies.
I, I guess I assumed at this point in my life, I would be married or in a relationship, or even have a pet that didn’t run away or kill itself.
I mean, I can’t say for sure, but I swear that rabbit looked me right in the eye before it hopped in front of that car. Anyway, the longer I’m alone, the more desperate I get.
Okay, we’re all feeling it. Yes, I’ll go out with you.
Bernadette: Sure. So how can we help?
Stuart took that rejection like a pro.
Oh, you get used to it. Some guys you have to turn down over and over.
Oh. Look at you, two guys in one day.
Why does your Fitbit say you ran 174 miles yesterday?
Amy: Well, for starters, you might want to rethink some of this artwork. I mean, this woman’s actually on a leash like a dog.
Have you thought about advertising directly to females?
You can say it.
Do you not hear how creepy that sounds?

Stuart, believe it or not, I understand. You know, before I met Sheldon, I was alone for a really long time. I was so desperate for people to like me, when I met these guys, it took everything in my power to hide my insecurity.
Suddenly, the rabbit thing makes sense.
I don’t have much experience turning men down. It wasn’t so much fun.
Barry Kripke just asked me out.
Hi, how are you? I was wondering if you’d like to get a drink after work sometime.
I don’t know. I guess I assumed that I would eventually date other people, but this is happening so fast.
Well, I was hoping the next person I dated would be a little less like Sheldon.
I don’t know.
Oh, I don’t have to imagine it.
Hello.
Uh, Bernadette, you’re my ride.
How have you been?
How’d that go?
Well, actually, he, he already did.
I said no.
I didn’t know you were interested in dating.
Oh. Okay. Anyway, um, it’s nice to see you. You look good.
Barry: Gentlemen, welcome to the fencing cwub. Before we start, I just want to warn you, fencing isn’t a joke. I hope you’re not here because you think it’s going to be wike Star Wars.
Well, sowwy to disappoint you, but fencing is a sewious spowt. If you’re not wiwwing to put in the effowt, you might as well just weave now.
Awwight. Let’s begin with some fundamentals. This is the en garde position. Feet are in an L. Heels in a stwaight wine. Elbow is about a fist from the wib cage. Notice my dominant weg faces fowward.
Okay, show me en garde. Good. Knees bent, swightwy over the toe. Non-sword hand up for bawance.

The first move is called an advance. You move your fwont foot fowward, heel to toe. Back foot fowwows. So fwont foot fowward, heel to toe. Back foot fowwows. Now you twy. Advance. And advance. And advance.
Good. The next move is called a wetweat. Step back. Back foot first, toe to heel. Fwont foot fowwows. On thwee.
In fencing, we don’t call it a stab. We call it a touch.

Okay, on thwee, Cooper and Koothwappawi advance, the other two wetweat. One, two, thwee. Vewy good. Switch it up. One, two, thwee. Switch again. One, two, thwee. (Phone rings) Excuse me. Can I call you back? No, I’m teaching a cwass. Sure. Sure. An hour, tops. Yeah. Okay. Okay. Yeah. Okay. Thanks. And one, two, thwee.
With your foil extended, kick your fwont weg up and push off with your back weg. Now you twy. And again. And again.
And how are you gonna do that?
You’ve had one wesson. I’ll destwoy you.
Woman: I don’t know what that means.
Older woman: I’m married, and I’m her grandmother.
